Generate an alert of the following sentence knowing that the data in parenthesis is an Named-entity tag
and that the sentiment of the sentece is SA = neutral. You can use different alert sentences as long as 
you mention something related to the entity type of the subject and something related with the SA of
the phrase.

### SENTENCE
Voluteers (B-FAC) gather (I-PERSON) to (B-FAC) clean (B-FAC) up (B-FAC) the (B-FAC) city (B-FAC) park (B-FAC) after (B-FAC) signs (B-FAC) of (B-FAC) vandalism (B-FAC)

### EXAMPLE
An example of an alert is for the inputs: â€œMusk (B-PERSON) accused of giving Nazi (B-ORG) salute during Trump (B-PERSON) inauguration (B-EVENT) celebrations (I-EVENT)" SA = negative
output: " REPUTATION RISK: Musk mentioned NEGATIVELY"

Here is a possible alert for the given sentence:

"CITY MAINTENANCE ALERT: Volunteers gather to clean up city park after vandalism, reported in a NEUTRAL tone."

Alternatively, you could also use:

"FACILITY MANAGEMENT UPDATE: City park cleanup efforts underway, mentioned in a neutral context."

Or:

"COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT NOTICE: Volunteers work together to restore city park, reported without emotional bias."

These alerts aim to mention the entity type (in this case, FAC or facility-related entities such as city park) and the sentiment analysis (SA = neutral) of the sentence. Let me know if you'd like me to suggest more options!
